org.magnos.net
Class AbstractClient

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.net.AbstractClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.magnos.io.BufferStreamListener, Adapter, Client
Direct Known Subclasses:
TcpClient, TcpClient, UdpClient, UdpServerClient
public abstract class AbstractClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements Client, org.magnos.io.BufferStreamListener

A basic implementation of a client.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

connect

public boolean connect(java.net.SocketAddress address)
XXX Creates a Client connected to a server at the given address. If there is an error creating the client, null will be returned. The default ClientListener will be added to the client if non-null. This may be a blocking or non-blocking invocation depending on the implementation.

Specified by:
connect in interface Client
Parameters:
address - The address of the server to connect to.
Returns:
The reference to the newly created client, or null.

                       int port)
XXX Creates a Client connected to a server at the given address. If there is an error creating the client, null will be returned. The default ClientListener will be added to the client if non-null. This may be a blocking or non-blocking invocation depending on the implementation.

Specified by:
connect in interface Client
Parameters:
host - The host of the server to connect to.
port - The port of the server to connect to.
Returns:
The reference to the newly created client, or null.

close

public final void close()
Closes this client immediately. This may deallocate all associated resources and close any open sockets.

Specified by:
close in interface Client

handleRead

public final void handleRead()
Notifies the server/client that it can now read from its socket. This should not be invoked outside of the server/clients worker/acceptor.

Specified by:
handleRead in interface Adapter

Specified by:
handleConnect in interface Adapter

isClosed

public final boolean isClosed()
Returns whether this client has been closed.

Specified by:
isClosed in interface Client
Returns:
True if the client is closed, otherwise false.

isDisconnecting

public final boolean isDisconnecting()
Returns whether this client is currently disconnecting. If this client is disconnecting the client will close once all pending data is sent to the server.

Specified by:
isDisconnecting in interface Client
Returns:
True if the client is disconnecting, otherwise false.

disconnect

public final void disconnect()
Disconnects this client by telling it to close once all pending data is sent to the server.

Specified by:
disconnect in interface Client

Specified by:
onBufferFlush in interface org.magnos.io.BufferStreamListener

setProtocol

public final void setProtocol(java.lang.Class<?> type)
Sets the current protocol of the client. When the server sends data the client will use the current protocol to parse that data. If the current protocol is not capable of reading the data on this client the input will grow with all data received until the client properly processes the data in the input stream. This should be changed very carefully.

Specified by:
setProtocol in interface Client
Parameters:
type - The new protocol type.

getProtocol

public final java.lang.Class<?> getProtocol()
The current protocol of the client for reading. This can be changed at any time but once its changed the data coming from the server will now be read with the new protocol.

Specified by:
getProtocol in interface Client
Returns:
The protocol type.

getPipeline

public final Pipeline getPipeline()
The pipeline this client is communicating through. This is used by the client to retrieve protocols for serializing and un-serializing data.

Specified by:
getPipeline in interface Client
Returns:
The reference to this clients pipeline.

send

public final void send(java.lang.Object data)
Send the given data to the server this client is connected to. The data is not guaranteed to be sent immediately but it will be placed on a queue. The class of the given object will dictate which protocol is used to serialize the object, if there is no protocol associated with the object then the object will be discarded.

Specified by:
send in interface Client
Parameters:
data - The data to send to the server.

pending

public java.util.Queue<java.lang.Object> pending()
Returns the queue of the pending data to be sent to the server. This is not thread safe and the returned queue should not be modified.

Specified by:
pending in interface Client
Returns:
The reference to the queue of pending data.

setBuffering

public void setBuffering(boolean buffering)
Sets whether this client will buffer its messages to send into a single chunk of data to be sent. A client can only buffer data when several objects exist in the pending queue, else the client never buffers data.

Specified by:
setBuffering in interface Client
Parameters:
buffering - True if the client should attempt to buffer objects together, otherwise false.

isBuffering

public boolean isBuffering()
Returns whether this client will buffers its messages to send into a single chunk of data to be sent. A client can only buffer data when several objects exist in the pending queue, else the client never buffers data.

Specified by:
isBuffering in interface Client
Returns:
True if the client should attempt to buffer objects together, otherwise false.

decode

protected int decode()
Decodes the input stream for objects, using the current protocol. If the input stream has been freed or not enough data exists in the input stream to fully decode an object 0 will be returned. For each non-null object decoded the client listener will be notified of a received object.

Returns:
The number of objects decoded from the input stream.

encode

protected int encode()
Encodes the output stream with all pending objects placing them in a the output to be sent as a single entity. If any data being encoded does not have an associated protocol a NullPointerException will be thrown.

Returns:
The number of objects successfully encoded and placed in output.

state

public final org.magnos.util.State state()
Returns the current state of this client. This is controlled internally and should not be modified externally.

Specified by:
state in interface Client
Returns:
The reference to the client's state.

getWorker

public Worker getWorker()
Returns the worker that handles this client.

Specified by:
getWorker in interface Client
Returns:
The reference to the worker that handles this client.

getServer

public final Server getServer()
Returns the server which accepted the client. This will be null if this client has connected to a server.

Specified by:
getServer in interface Client
Returns:
The reference to the server.

getListeners

public final java.util.List<ClientListener> getListeners()
Returns the list of listeners of events on this client. Listeners can be directly added to this list.

Specified by:
getListeners in interface Client
Returns:
The reference to the list of listeners.

getInput

public final org.magnos.io.BufferStream getInput()
Returns the input stream of the client. This should not be directly accessed but if it is the skip method must be called on the stream in order to ensure the read bytes are discarded.

Specified by:
getInput in interface Client
Returns:
The reference to the output BufferStream.

getOutput

public final org.magnos.io.BufferStream getOutput()
Returns the output stream of the client. This should not be directly accessed but if it is the flush method must be called on the stream in order to notify the client it has data to send.

Specified by:
getOutput in interface Client
Returns:
The reference to the input BufferStream.

attach

public void attach(java.lang.Object attachment)
Attaches any object to this client. The object to attach can be retrieved at any time but is not thread safe.

Specified by:
attach in interface Client
Parameters:
attachment - The object to attach to this client.

attachment

public java.lang.Object attachment()
Returns the last object attached to this client. This is not thread safe.

Specified by:
attachment in interface Client
Returns:
The object attached to this client.
